intro: Homalium arboreum, commonly known as the red-flowered evergreen. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its ornamental value due to its vibrant red flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, with elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are often used in traditional medicine. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that attracts birds and plays a role in seed dispersal.
